alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Granville; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Durham, Granville, Orange and Wake. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Butner, RDU International, Morrisville, Bethesda, Parkwood, Gorman, Research Triangle, Eno River State Park, Rollingview Marina, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area and Jordan Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
